TextView.android:text:
Artificing is the term used to describe the now legendary skills of a blacksmith. By using special blueprints, a blacksmith can craft weapons, armour and accessories that become the stuff of legends.

		Items with Blueprints crafted on them are naturally resistant to magic. Any ritual placed on them will fade very quickly after being cast. This can be anywhere between 10 minutes and a few days as determined by the ritual marshal.

		Blueprints can be stacked with other Blueprints and can be crafted multiple times after creation, unless otherwise specified. Should the Blueprint crafting fail the legendary item is not consumed or destroyed. 

		The process of crafting from a formula or blueprint is identical. All formulas and blueprints range in difficulty from 1 to 20. On the formula or blueprint will be the Master Catalysts required, the difficulty level, the required RM types and possibly, although rare, specific items of note. Both formulas and blueprints are considered regular paper and can be easily destroyed, so protect them! 

		All crafting attempts are made at logistics and cannot be attempted once logistics is closed.

		Artifice has set RM requirements based on the difficulty of the blueprint. A difficulty 1 Blueprint requires 100RM and 1 Master Catalyst, as specified on the blueprint. Each additional level will add +25RM and +1 Master Catalyst requirements. Some blueprints will also require special materials and ways to prepare them.

		All items created via Artifice will have a default expiry of 1 year. This may be extended by multiplying the RM and catalysts required. For each multiplication, 1 year will be added to the expiry. Extending the duration will not use extra charges. Example: If a Blueprint required 200RM and 5 Master Catalysts, then using 600RM and 15 Master Catalysts in it’s creation will give it an expiry of 3 years.

		Additional catalysts may optionally be used to increase the odds of success.

		The marshal will prepare the bag of stones with 20 white stones. They will add black stones equal to the difficulty of the formula or blueprint and 5 black stones for each missing Master Catalyst, any catalysts used to extend the duration of a blueprint are considered Master Catalysts. They will also add 1 white stone for each catalyst provided in excess of the required Master Catalysts.

		The crafter will blindly pull a single stone from the bag. A white stone means the craft was a success. A black stone means the craft has failed.
\t\tNote: These are short descriptions of artifices commonly known in-game. Additional synergies exist but you must discover them in game!
A lighter chainmail that is just as strong.
Secures a weapon to your hand, even when unconscious.
Extra protection for the heel and hamstring.
Reinforces a shield to push back an opponent.
Does extra damage against a specific target.
Leather armour that repairs itself over time.
Enchants a weapon to reflect spellstrikes.
Heavy boots that resist knockbacks and pushes.
Destroys garrottes when used against it.
Armour that will automatically inject alchemy when the wearer becomes horizontal.
Does extra damage against a specific race.
Reflects magic spells cast on it.
Absorbs thunder / lightning then spellstrikes it.
Allows you to detect undead when worn.
Restores 1 Master Craft resist on shields and weapons.
Makes you a little stronger if you wear them.
This armour slips out of binding effects.
Enchants a blunt weapon to destroy armour.
Enchants scalemail to grant a threshold.
Causes your blunt weapon to stun your foes.
Opening this chest fills the area with sunlight.
Opening this chest fills the area with darkness.
Enchants a weapon to be magical, but it isn’t.
A surgeon’s kit with 5 different abilities.
Allows your strength to increase bow damage
A mirror that terrifies spirits and mystics and also hides your presence from spirits if it’s near to you.
Enchants a weapon to prevent extra-planar creatures from escaping home.
Enchants 2 weapons to copy any benefit on one to both if used simultaneously.
A thrown weapon that penetrates undead with sunlight.
A treasure box that destroys its contents if tampered with.
Allows you to sense living creatures.
Enchants boots to help kill insects.
Provides protection against 1 type of elemental damage.
Adds gears to armour that will automatically move you in your previous direction for 1 minute if mortally wounded.
An arrow that flies toward its target, never missing.
Adds 1 year duration to an existing blueprint.
Protection vs the first 3 spells that hit it every day.
An enchanted item that drains blood from a target.
Grants immunity to death effects and allows you to catch them for reuse.
Extra damage vs animals / plants, inflicts a disease on them and provides protection against their binding effects.
When blown, grants immunity to fear and gives weapons in the hands of Einher extra striking power.
Enchants armour to function against acid damage.
Allows the creation of Stone, Iron or War golems.
